item.title: Propaganda
item.description: The following artworks were discovered on a USB drive in a drawer in Argentina, the coordinates of which were hidden deep within the archives of a long-defunct Albanian numismatists' forum.

item.title: Three monkeys and a mild realisation
item.description: As I walked away, apes in hand, I realised that I had just parted with the equivalent of two decent meals for some monkeys.

item.title: STOP PRINTING
item.description: Printing is a plague on modern work culture, a relic from an era when people thought paper was the pinnacle of human achievement.

item.title: 2 Japan stories
item.description: Three employees joined in, gesturing animatedly and stumbling through fragmented English.

item.title: Linguistic misconceptions
item.description: Here are a few common misconceptions about languages.

item.title: Fountains
item.description: I think fountains are really nice. They improve the overall vibe of a public space by at least 80%.

item.title: Insidious files
item.description: However, firefox's network tool showed me that my favicon was adding a whopping 100kb to every page!

item.title: Pool topology
item.description: I like swimming a lot; so when choosing a hotel, the pool is a pretty significant factor for me. How big is it? Is it indoors or outdoors? How deep is it? What is its shape?

item.title: The tower
item.description: Hesitating a little, i ventured within via the main entrance.

item.title: How to remove data from Radaris
item.description: Moral of the story is, don't use the internet, and fuck Radaris.
